TEXT: The applicants , GPE , GPE and PERSON , are NORP citizens , born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively and living in GPE . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent Ms PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the first applicant acquired a specially protected tenancy on a flat in GPE ; the second and third applicants are his wife and son . They all lived together in the flat in question . On DATE , while the applicants were absent from GPE , CARDINAL members of ORG broke the door and occupied the flat .

On DATE the third applicant instituted proceedings with ORG ( PERSON ) seeking reinstatement and interim measures so as to obtain the keys of the new lock for the flat ’s main entrance and to evict the defendants from the flat . On DATE the court ordered interim measures as requested by the third applicant . On DATE the same court decided in accordance with the third applicant ’s claims .

In the meantime , on DATE , ORG ( ORG ) granted temporary possession of the flat in question to PERSON ( although that person was already deceased ) and to his wife NORP The first and third applicants challenged that decision and on DATE ORG ( ORG ) quashed the ORG ’s decision on the merits .

Meanwhile NORP had occupied the flat . Upon the third applicant ’s request ORG ordered NORP to vacate the LOC on DATE . As NORP did not comply with the court ’s order , the first and third applicants sought , and on DATE obtained , a decision on the judicial enforcement of the court ’s decision ( rješenje o izvršenju ) . NORP filed a motion to object that decision , but her motion was denied on DATE . In addition ORG ( NORP za socijalni rad ORG ) , as well as ORG , filed motions for an order staying the execution , which were denied on DATE . Subsequent attempts to evict NORP from the flat by the court ’s officials remained unsuccessful due to the presence of armed persons dressed in ORG uniforms , inside and around the flat , opposing the eviction .

NORP occupied the flat until DATE when she moved out without informing the applicants or ORG , and at the same time PERSON , a member of the NORP military police , moved in . DATE the applicants’ possessions from the flat were removed by persons dressed in ORG uniforms using military trucks . On DATE ORG granted temporary possession of the flat to Z.
The applicants did not appeal against that decision .

On DATE ORG ( ORG pravobraniteljstvo ) instituted proceedings against the first applicant in ORG requesting the termination of his specially protected tenancy on the flat in question , alleging that he had not occupied the flat for DATE . ORG considered the first applicant ’s address to be unknown and appointed a legal representative for him ( staratelj za poseban slučaj ) .

On DATE ORG terminated the first applicant ’s specially protected tenancy accepting the claim that he and his family had not occupied the flat for DATE without a justified reason . Thus , the first applicant lost all his rights regarding the flat in question . Upon the representative ’s appeal ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) on DATE upheld the first instance decision confirming the reasoning of ORG .

The first applicant was not notified of those decisions , but only his legal representative , who was unknown to him . It appears that on DATE an attorney , whom the applicants claim was unknown to them , filed an application to return the proceedings to the status quo ante ( prijedlog za povrat u prijašnje stanje ) with ORG .

On DATE the first and second applicants filed an application for the re - opening of the proceedings ( prijedlog za ponavljanje postupka ) with ORG , on the basis that the legal representative appointed in the proceedings concerning the termination of the first applicant ’s specially protected tenancy was not aware of the facts that might have been decisive for the outcome of the proceedings such as the fact that ORG had quashed ORG decision to grant temporary possession of the flat to a third person .

On DATE ORG rejected the application to return the proceedings to the status quo ante as having being lodged out of time . On DATE ORG rejected the first and second applicants’ application for the re - opening of the proceedings for the same reason . It appears that on DATE the first and the second applicants appealed against the decision concerning the re - opening of the proceedings .
On DATE the first and second applicants requested the speeding - up of the proceedings .
On DATE the case file was transferred to ORG it being the appellate court .
On DATE the first and second applicants again requested the speeding - up of the proceedings .

On DATE ORG remitted the case to ORG , without deciding upon the applicants’ appeal . ORG instructed ORG to hold a hearing so as to obtain information relevant for reaching the decision upon the first and second ORG appeal .
On DATE the first and second applicants requested for the third time the speeding - up of the proceedings .

On DATE ORG held a hearing . At that hearing the first and third applicants gave their testimonies as to whether a legal representative who lodged the application to return the proceedings to the status quo ante was given a power of attorney by them .
At the next hearing , which took place on DATE , the second applicant gave testimony in respect of the same question .
On DATE ORG sent the case file to ORG .

On DATE the case was again remitted to ORG in order to obtain its explanation in regard of the applicants’ objection to the written TIME of the hearing of DATE . Furthermore , the court of first instance was requested to enclose a copy of its decision of DATE and a copy of the first and second ORG appeal against that decision .
On DATE the ORG quashed ORG decisions of DATE and DATE and remitted the case to the court of first instance .

On DATE ORG dismissed the application to return the proceeding to the status quo ante as it had been submitted by a representative without a power of attorney . It also dismissed the first and second applicants’ application for the re - opening of the proceedings , again as having been lodged out of time .
On DATE the first and second applicants appealed against ORG decision concerning their request for the re - opening of the proceedings . It appears that the cases are presently pending before ORG .
